    • Method Detail

      • getAllophoneSet

        public static AllophoneSet getAllophoneSet(String filename)
                                    throws MaryConfigurationException
        Return the allophone set specified by the given filename. It will only be loaded if it was not loaded before.
        Parameters:
        filename - filename
        Returns:
        the allophone set, if one can be created. This method will never return null.
        Throws:
        MaryConfigurationException - if no allophone set can be loaded from the given file.

      • hasAllophoneSet

        public static boolean hasAllophoneSet(String identifier)
        Determine whether the registry of previously loaded allophone sets already contains an allophone set with the given identifier. If this returns true, then a call to getAllophoneSetById(String) with the same identifier will return a non-null Allophone set.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of the allophone set to test.
        Returns:
        true if the registry already contains the given allophone set, false otherwise.

      • getAllophoneSetById

        public static AllophoneSet getAllophoneSetById(String identifier)
        Get a previously loaded allophone set by its identifier. The method will make no attempt to load the allophone set if it is not yet available.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of the allophone set
        Returns:
        the allophone set if available, null otherwise.

      • getAllophoneSet

        public static AllophoneSet getAllophoneSet(InputStream inStream,
                                           String identifier)
                                    throws MaryConfigurationException
        Return the allophone set that can be read from the given input stream, identified by the given identifier. It will only be loaded if it was not loaded before.
        Parameters:
        inStream - an open stream from which the allophone set can be loaded. it will be closed when this method returns.
        identifier - a unique identifier for this allophone set.
        Returns:
        the allophone set, if one can be created. This method will never return null.
        Throws:
        MaryConfigurationException - if no allophone set can be loaded from the given file.

        public Locale getLocale()

        public Allophone getAllophone(String ph)
        Get the Allophone with the given name
        Parameters:
        ph - name of Allophone to get
        Returns:
        the Allophone
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Allophone is not found in the AllophoneSet

        public Allophone getSilence()
        Obtain the silence allophone in this AllophoneSet
        Returns:

      • getIgnoreChars

        public String getIgnoreChars()
        Obtain the ignore chars in this AllophoneSet Default: "',-"
        Returns:

      • getPhoneFeature

        public String getPhoneFeature(String ph,
                              String featureName)
        For the Allophone with name ph, return the value of the named feature.
        Parameters:
        ph - ph
        featureName - feature name
        Returns:
        the allophone feature, or null if either the allophone or the feature does not exist.

      • getPhoneFeatures

        public Set<String> getPhoneFeatures()
        Get the list of available phone features for this allophone set.
        Returns:
        Collections.unmodifiableSet(featureValueMap.keySet())

      • getPossibleFeatureValues

        public String[] getPossibleFeatureValues(String featureName)
        For the given feature name, get the list of all possible values that the feature can take in this allophone set.
        Parameters:
        featureName - featureName
        Returns:
        the list of values, "0" first.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if featureName is not a known feature name.

      • getAllophoneNames

        public Set<String> getAllophoneNames()
        This returns the names of all allophones contained in this AllophoneSet, as a Set of Strings
        Returns:
        allophoneKeySet

      • splitIntoAllophones

        public Allophone[] splitIntoAllophones(String allophoneString)
        Split a phonetic string into allophone symbols. Symbols representing primary and secondary stress, syllable boundaries, and spaces, will be silently skipped.
        Parameters:
        allophoneString - the phonetic string to split
        Returns:
        an array of Allophone objects corresponding to the string given as input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the allophoneString contains unknown symbols.

      • splitAllophoneString

        public String splitAllophoneString(String allophoneString)
        Split allophone string into a list of allophone symbols. Include stress markers (',) and syllable boundaries (-), skip space characters.
        Parameters:
        allophoneString - allophoneString
        Returns:
        a String containing allophones and stress markers / syllable boundaries, separated with spaces
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the string contains illegal symbols.

      • splitIntoAllophoneList

        public List<String> splitIntoAllophoneList(String allophonesString)
        Split allophone string into a list of allophone symbols, preserving all stress and syllable boundaries that may be present
        Parameters:
        allophonesString - allophonesString
        Returns:
        a List of allophone Strings
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if allophoneString contains a symbol for which no Allophone can be found

      • checkAllophoneSyntax

        public boolean checkAllophoneSyntax(String allophoneString)
        Check whether the given allophone string has a correct syntax according to this allophone set.
        Parameters:
        allophoneString - allophoneString
        Returns:
        true if the syntax is correct, false otherwise.

      • syllabify

        public String syllabify(String phoneString)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Syllabify a string of allophones. If stress markers are provided, they are preserved; otherwise, primary stress will be assigned to the initial syllable.

        The syllabification algorithm itself follows the Core Syllabification Principle (CSP) from

        G.N. Clements (1990) "The role of the sonority cycle in core syllabification." In: J. Kingston & M.E. Beckman (Eds.), Papers in Laboratory Phonology I: Between the Grammar and Physics of Speech, Ch. 17, pp. 283-333, Cambridge University Press.
        Parameters:
        phoneString - phoneString
        Returns:
        a syllabified string; individual allophones are separated by spaces, and syllables, by dashes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the phoneString is empty or contains a symbol that satisfies none of the following conditions:
        1. the symbol corresponds to an Allophone, or
        2. the symbol is a stress symbol (cf. AllophoneSet.Stress), or
        3. the symbol is a syllable boundary (-)
